decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The works to which this consent relates, must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.
Reason: To accord with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation areas) Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Covering statement letter dated 24 June 2024, 1:1250 Local Plan, Nursery demand and employment from the nursery, Heritage Impact Assessment May 2024, Existing Floor Layout Ground Floor Sheet 01, Existing Floor Layout First Floor Sheet 2, Existing Floor Layout Loft Sheet 03, Existing Elevation West Sheet 4, Existing Elevation South Sheet 5, Existing Elevation East Sheet 6, Existing Elevation North Sheet 7, Proposed Floor Layout Sheet 01, Proposed Floor Layout Sheet 2, Proposed Floor Layout Sheet 3, Proposed Elevation Sheet 4, Proposed Elevation Sheet 5, Proposed Elevation Sheet 6, Proposed Elevation Sheet 7, BL221122-03, Proposed Fire Exit Door Sheet 8, Proposed Fire Exit Door Sheet 9. Risk and Fire Consulting Ltd letter 30 January 2024. FireNet Security Letter].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - All new internal and external works, including works of making good for the retained fabric, shall match the original work in type, colour, texture, profile and dimensions of materials and in detailed execution, including facebond and pointing. 
Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic features of the listed building (and/or the character of the Conservation Area).

Condition : 4 - All existing architectural features including staircases, balustrades, windows, doors, architraves, skirtings, dados, picture rails, panel work, fireplaces, tiling, corbelled arches, cornices, decorative ceilings and other decorative features shall be retained except where otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority and shall be protected from damage during the course of the works hereby approved.

For the avoidance of doubt, fixing points for any handrail or railing into any part of the existing building shall be kept at a minimum and shall be made into the mortar joints between the stones using non-ferrous fixings; where this is required, full details of these fixings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Planning Authority prior to any works on site.
Reason: In order to safeguard the architectural and historic interest of the listed building.

Condition : 5 - The toilet cubicles on the first floor as shown on approved drawing number 'Proposed Floor Layout Sheet 2', shall be removed immediately should the use as a nursery cease or be abandoned. 
Reason. In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic features of the listed building
description: Listed Building Consent for the installation of an external first floor rear fire escape staircase and door with internal alterations to the building including the provision of additional toilet cubicles.
